result.execSummary:
The defendant Liza M Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
No contact with Walmart in Plover and No contact with co-dependants as listed in the complaint.
Engage and comply in any other treatment related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Probation can be transferred to her residence.
AODA if haven't had one within the last 6 months & comply with treatment recommendations and any inpatient treatment if recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other prison sentence currently being served

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Comply with any recommended AODA treatment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
No contact with Walmart in Plover or any of her co-defendant's as indicated in the criminal complaint.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Liza M Carlson in court with attorney William George Weiland. Defendant Liza M Carlson in custody.  Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:13 a.m.  Atty Cousins calls the case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
State has complied with victim notification; no representative of Walmart appears in Court.
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing

BY THE COURT:
Prison sentence of 3 years - concurrent with any other prison sentence currently being served:
1 year 6 months initial confinement
161 days of credit
1 year 6 months extended supervision -
**Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
No contact with Walmart in Plover or any of her co-defendant's as indicated in the criminal complaint
Comply with any recommended AODA treatment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Outstanding fines/costs and restitution to be paid out of the defendant's prison fund 
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ TTF 12/14/16

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Liza M Carlson in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Liza M Carlson in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant is quashed.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Probation with conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets concurs with joint recommendation. 
(Walmart) victim was notified and is not present.

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION**
W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation
Conditions:
  AODA if haven't had one within the last 6 months & comply with treatment recommendations and any inpatient treatment if recommended.
30 hrs of Community Service
Pay $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharge + Drug Abuse Surcharges.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
No contact with Walmart in Plover and No contact with co-dependants as listed in the complaint.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Engage and comply in any other treatment related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Probation can be transferred to her residence.
and Writ of Habeas
